00008 // returns distance from point p to line x0-x1
00009 template <class num>
00010 num distance_to_line(const vector2d<num> x0,const vector2d<num> x1,const vector2d<num> p)
00011 {
00012   // dot with unit length normal to line
00013   return(fabs((x1 - x0).norm().perpdot(p - x0)));
00014 }
00015 
00016 // returns perpendicular offset from line x0-x1 to point p
00017 template <class num>
00018 num offset_to_line(const vector2d<num> x0,const vector2d<num> x1,const vector2d<num> p)
00019 {
00020   vector2d<num> n;
00021 
00022   // get normal to line
00023   n = (x1 - x0).perp().norm();
00024 
00025   return(n.dot(p - x0));
00026 }
00027 
00028 // returns perpendicular offset from line x0-x1 to point p
00029 template <class num>
00030 num offset_along_line(const vector2d<num> x0,const vector2d<num> x1,const vector2d<num> p)
00031 {
00032   vector2d<num> n,v;
00033 
00034   // get normal to line
00035   n = x1 - x0;
00036   n.normalize();
00037 
00038   v = p - x0;
00039 
00040   return(n.dot(v));
00041 }

00043 // returns nearest point on segment a0-a1 to line b0-b1
00044 template <class num>
00045 vector2d<num> segment_near_line(const vector2d<num> a0,const vector2d<num> a1,
00046                                 const vector2d<num> b0,const vector2d<num> b1)
00047 {
00048   vector2d<num> v,n,p;
00049   double dn,t;
00050 
00051   v = a1-a0;
00052   n = (b1-b0).norm();
00053   n.set(-n.y,n.x);
00054 
00055   dn = dot(v,n);
00056   if(fabs(dn) < EPSILON) return(a0);
00057 
00058   t = -dot(a0-b0,n) / dn;
00059   // printf("t=%f dn=%f\n",t,dn);
00060   if(t < 0) t = 0;
00061   if(t > 1) t = 1;
00062   p = a0 + v*t;
00063 
00064   return(p);
00065 }
00066 
00067 //
00068 template <class num>
00069 vector2d<num> intersection(const vector2d<num> a1, const vector2d<num> a2,
00070                            const vector2d<num> b1, const vector2d<num> b2)
00071 {
00072   vector2d<num> a = a2 - a1;
00073 
00074   vector2d<num> b1r = (b1 - a1).rotate(-a.angle());
00075   vector2d<num> b2r = (b2 - a1).rotate(-a.angle());
00076   vector2d<num> br = (b1r - b2r);
00077 
00078   return 
00079     vector2d<num>(b2r.x - b2r.y * (br.x / br.y), 0.0).rotate(a.angle()) + a1;
00080 }

00082 // gives counterclockwise angle from <a-b> to <c-b>
00083 template <class num>
00084 num vertex_angle(const vector2d<num> a,
00085                  const vector2d<num> b,
00086                  const vector2d<num> c)
00087 {
00088   return(angle_mod((a-b).angle() - (c-b).angle()));
00089 }

00091 // calc_circle
00092 template <class num>
00093 bool CalcCircle(vector2d<num> &cen,num &rad,
00094                 const vector2d<num> p1,
00095                 const vector2d<num> p2,
00096                 const vector2d<num> p3)
00097 {
00098   vector2d<num> a,b;
00099   num da,db;
00100 
00101   // edge vectors
00102   a = (p2 - p1);
00103   b = (p3 - p2);
00104 
00105   // dot products of midpoint of each edge vector
00106   da = a.dot(p1 + p2) * 0.5;
00107   db = b.dot(p2 + p3) * 0.5;
00108 
00109   /*
00110   We want to find a point c on each line, so:
00111     [ a.x a.y ] [c.x] = [da]
00112     [ b.x b.y ] [c.y]   [db]
00113 
00114   We can invert the matrix to do that, and multiply it on the left of both
00115   side.  That yeilds a direct expression for center point c.
00116   */
00117 
00118   num det = a.x * b.y - a.y * b.x;
00119   if(fabs(det) < EPSILON) return(false);
00120 
00121   cen.x = ( b.y*da + -a.y*db) / det;
00122   cen.y = (-b.x*da +  a.x*db) / det;
00123 
00124   // use averaging to get a more numerically accurate radius
00125   // rad = sqrt((sqdist(cen,p1) + sqdist(cen,p2) + sqdist(cen,p3)) / 3.0);
00126   rad = dist(cen,p1);
00127 
00128   if(false){
00129     printf("%f %f, %f %f\n",
00130            a.dot(cen),da,
00131            b.dot(cen),db);
00132   }
00133 
00134   return(true);
00135 }

00140 template <class vector>
00141 vector interpolate(const vector x0,const vector x1,double t)
00142 {
00143   // t = bound(t, 0.0, 1.0);
00144   return(x0 + (x1-x0)*t);
00145 }
00146 
00147 template <class vector>
00148 vector point_on_line(const vector x0,const vector x1,const vector p)
00149 // returns nearest point on line through x0-x1 to point p
00150 // Preconditions: x0!=x1
00151 {
00152   vector sx,sp,r;
00153   double f,l;
00154 
00155   sx = x1 - x0;
00156   sp = p  - x0;
00157 
00158   f = dot(sx,sp);
00159   l = sx.sqlength();
00160 
00161   // if line is degenerate, any point will do
00162   if(l < EPSILON) return(p);
00163 
00164   // calculate point along line nearest to p
00165   r = x0 + sx * (f / l);
00166   return(r);
00167 }
00168 
00169 template <class vector>
00170 vector point_on_segment(const vector x0,const vector x1,const vector p)
00171 // returns nearest point on line segment x0-x1 to point p
00172 {
00173   vector sx,sp,r;
00174   double f,l;
00175 
00176   sx = x1 - x0;
00177   sp = p  - x0;
00178 
00179   f = dot(sx,sp);
00180   if(f <= 0.0) return(x0); // also handles x0=x1 case
00181 
00182   l = sx.sqlength();
00183   if(f >= l) return(x1);
00184 
00185   r = x0 + sx * (f / l);
00186 
00187   return(r);
00188 }

00190 
00191 template <class vector>
00192 double point_on_segment_t(const vector x0,const vector x1,const vector p)
00193 // returns nearest point on line segment x0-x1 to point p
00194 {
00195   vector sx,sp,r;
00196   double f,l;
00197 
00198   sx = x1 - x0;
00199   sp = p  - x0;
00200 
00201   f = dot(sx,sp);
00202   l = sx.sqlength();
00203 
00204   if (f <= 0) return 0.0;
00205   else if(f >= l) return 1.0;
00206   else return (f/l);
00207 
00208 }

00210 // returns shortest distance between line segment x0-x1 to point p
00211 template <class vector>
00212 double distance_to_segment(const vector x0,const vector x1,const vector p)
00213 {
00214   vector sx,sp,r;
00215   double f,l;
00216 
00217   sx = x1 - x0;
00218   sp = p  - x0;
00219 
00220   f = dot(sx,sp);
00221   if(f <= 0.0) return(distance(x0,p)); // also handles x0=x1 case
00222 
00223   l = sx.sqlength();
00224   if(f >= l) return(distance(x1,p));
00225 
00226   r = x0 + sx * (f / l);
00227 
00228   return(distance(r,p));
00229 }
00230 
00231 template <class vector>
00232 double closest_point_time(const vector x1,const vector v1,
00233                           const vector x2,const vector v2)
00234 // returns time of closest point of approach of two points
00235 // moving along constant velocity vectors.
00236 {
00237   vector v  = v1 - v2;
00238   double sl = v.sqlength();
00239   double t;
00240 
00241   if(sl < EPSILON) return(0.0); // parallel tracks, any time is ok.
00242 
00243   t = -v.dot(x1 - x2) / sl;
00244   if(t < 0.0) return(0.0); // nearest time was in the past, now
00245                            // is closest point from now on.
00246 
00247   return(t);
00248 }
00249 
00250 // Ported from: dist3D_Segment_to_Segment
00251 //   from http://geometryalgorithms.com
00252 // Copyright 2001, softSurfer (www.softsurfer.com)
00253 // This code may be freely used and modified for any purpose providing
00254 // that this copyright notice is included with it.  SoftSurfer makes
00255 // no warranty for this code, and cannot be held liable for any real
00256 // or imagined damage resulting from its use.  Users of this code must
00257 // verify correctness for their application.
00258 template <class vector>
00259 double distance_seg_to_seg(vector s1a,vector s1b,vector s2a,vector s2b)
00260 // return distnace between segments s1a-s1b and s2a-s2b
00261 {
00262   vector dp;
00263   vector u = s1b - s1a;
00264   vector v = s2b - s2a;
00265   vector w = s1a - s2a;
00266   float a = dot(u,u);        // always >= 0
00267   float b = dot(u,v);
00268   float c = dot(v,v);        // always >= 0
00269   float d = dot(u,w);
00270   float e = dot(v,w);
00271   float D = a*c - b*b;       // always >= 0
00272   float sc, sN, sD = D;      // sc = sN / sD, default sD = D >= 0
00273   float tc, tN, tD = D;      // tc = tN / tD, default tD = D >= 0
00274 
00275   if(true){
00276     printf("SegDist (%f,%f)-(%f,%f) to (%f,%f)-(%f,%f) a=%f b=%f\n",
00277            V2COMP(s1a),V2COMP(s1b),V2COMP(s2a),V2COMP(s2b),
00278            a,b);
00279   }
00280 
00281   if((a < EPSILON) || (b < EPSILON)){
00282     if((a < EPSILON) && (b < EPSILON)){
00283       return(dist(s1a,s2a));
00284     }else if(a < EPSILON){
00285       return(distance_to_segment(s2a,s2b,s1a));
00286     }else{
00287       return(distance_to_segment(s1a,s1b,s2a));
00288     }
00289   }
00290 
00291   // compute the line parameters of the two closest points
00292   if(D < EPSILON){ // the lines are almost parallel
00293     sN = 0.0; // force using point P0 on segment S1
00294     sD = 1.0; // to prevent possible division by 0.0 later
00295     tN = e;
00296     tD = c;
00297   }else{                // get the closest points on the infinite lines
00298     sN = (b*e - c*d);
00299     tN = (a*e - b*d);
00300     if(sN < 0){         // sc < 0 => the s=0 edge is visible
00301       sN = 0.0;
00302       tN = e;
00303       tD = c;
00304     }else if(sN > sD){  // sc > 1 => the s=1 edge is visible
00305       sN = sD;
00306       tN = e + b;
00307       tD = c;
00308     }
00309   }
00310 
00311   if(tN < 0){           // tc < 0 => the t=0 edge is visible
00312     tN = 0.0;
00313     // recompute sc for this edge
00314     if(-d < 0){
00315       sN = 0.0;
00316     }else if(-d > a){
00317       sN = sD;
00318     }else{
00319       sN = -d;
00320       sD = a;
00321     }
00322   }else if(tN > tD){      // tc > 1 => the t=1 edge is visible
00323     tN = tD;
00324     // recompute sc for this edge
00325     if((-d + b) < 0){
00326       sN = 0;
00327     }else if((-d + b) > a){
00328       sN = sD;
00329     }else{
00330       sN = (-d + b);
00331       sD = a;
00332     }
00333   }
00334 
00335 
00336   // finally do the division to get sc and tc
00337   // sc = sN / sD;
00338   // tc = tN / tD;
00339   sc = (fabs(sN) < EPSILON)? 0.0 : sN / sD;
00340   tc = (fabs(tN) < EPSILON)? 0.0 : tN / tD;
00341 
00342   // get the difference of the two closest points
00343   dp = w + u*sc - v*tc; // = S1(sc) - S2(tc)
00344 
00345   return(dp.length()); // return the closest distance
00346 }

00348 // Inputs: plane origin, plane normal, ray origin ray vector.
00349 // NOTE: both vectors are assumed to be normalized
00350 template <class vector>
00351 double ray_plane_intersect(vector pOrigin,vector pNormal,
00352                            vector rOrigin,vector rVector)
00353 {
00354   //FIXME: if they're parallel, this will fail!
00355   return((dot(pNormal,pOrigin) - dot(pNormal,rOrigin)) /
00356          dot(pNormal,rVector));
00357 
00358   /*
00359   double numer = dot(pNormal,rOrigin) - dot(pNormal,pOrigin);
00360   double denom = dot(pNormal,rVector);
00361   return(-(numer / denom));
00362   */
00363 }

00371           (a.x - rOrigin.x)) -
00372           (rVector.x * b.y)) /
00373           (rVector.y * (a.x + b.x) -
00374           rVector.x * (a.y + b.y));
00375 
00376   return t;

00384 template <class vector, class real>
00385 real ray_sphere_intersect(vector rO, vector rV,vector sO,real sR)
00386 // intersect a ray (r0+rV*t) with a sphere at s0 with radius sR
00387 // returns: t, or -1 if no intersection
00388 // NOTE: rV is assumed to be normalized
00389 {
00390   vector Q = sO - rO;
00391   real c = Q.length();
00392   real v = dot(Q,rV);
00393   real d = sR*sR - (c*c - v*v);
00394 
00395   // If there was no intersection, return -1
00396   if(d < 0.0) return(-1.0);
00397 
00398   // Return the distance to the [first] intersecting point
00399   return(v - sqrt(d));
00400 }
00401 
00402 template <class vector, class real>
00403 real ray_stretched_circle_intersect(vector rO, vector rV,vector sO,real sR, vector stretchH)
00404 // |--- 
00405 // |   | 
00406 // X-sR-|   ------- 
00407 // |    |     | stretchH 
00408 // s0----   ------- 
00409 // |    | 
00410 // X----| 
00411 // |   | 
00412 // /--- 
00413 // intersect a ray (r0+rV*t) with a stretched circle at s0 with end radii sR and 2*stretchH between its two centers
00414 // returns: t, or -1 if no intersection
00415 // NOTE: rV is assumed to be normalized
00416 // yes, it's nasty code...but needed for the new defense area!
00417 {
00418 
00419   real t=(-1.0);
00420   vector p;
00421   bool found=false;
00422   //positive circle:
00423   real t1=ray_sphere_intersect(rO, rV,sO+stretchH,sR);
00424   if (t1 >= 0.0) {
00425     found=true;
00426     t=t1;
00427     p=(rO+(rV*t));
00428   }
00429 
00430   //negative circle:
00431   real t2=ray_sphere_intersect(rO, rV,sO-stretchH,sR);
00432   if (t2 >= 0.0) {
00433     if (found==false || t2 < t) {
00434       found=true;
00435       t=t2;
00436       p=(rO+(rV*t));
00437     }
00438   }
00439 
00440   //rotate stretchH by 90 degrees.
00441   //compute two planes:
00442   //one left, one right
00443   vector perp=(stretchH.perp()).norm(sR);
00444 
00445   real t3=ray_plane_intersect(sO+perp,perp,rO,rV);
00446   if (t3 >= 0.0) {
00447     if (found==false || t3 < t) {
00448       vector ptmp=(rO+(rV*t3));
00449       //check if intersection point is within the line-segment:
00450       if ((ptmp - (sO+perp)).sqlength() < stretchH.sqlength()) {
00451         found=true;
00452         t=t3;
00453         p=ptmp;
00454       }
00455     }
00456   }
00457 
00458 
00459   perp*=(-1.0);
00460   real t4=ray_plane_intersect(sO+perp,perp,rO,rV);
00461   if (t4 >= 0.0) {
00462     if (found==false || t4 < t) {
00463       vector ptmp=(rO+(rV*t4));
00464       //check if intersection point is within the line-segment:
00465       if ((ptmp - (sO+perp)).sqlength() < stretchH.sqlength()) {
00466         found=true;
00467         t=t4;
00468         p=ptmp;
00469       }
00470     }
00471   }
00472   
00473   return t;
00474 }

00477 template <class vector, class real>
00478 bool CircleTangentDir(vector cen,real rad,vector p,
00479                       vector &left,vector &right)
00480 {
00481   vector delta,basis;
00482   vector tl,tr;
00483   double d2,l,t;
00484 
00485   // l,r,d form a right triangle where l*l + rad*rad = d*d = d2
00486   delta = cen - p;
00487   d2 = delta.sqlength();
00488 
00489   t = d2 - rad*rad;
00490   if(t < 0) return(false); // inside circle
00491 
00492   // set basis as sin/d,cos/d
00493   l = sqrt(t);
00494   basis.set(l/d2,rad/d2);
00495 
00496   // project to get left and right tangents
00497   // resulting vectors are normalized
00498   left = basis.project_out(delta);
00499   basis.y = -basis.y;
00500   right = basis.project_out(delta);
00501 
00502   return(true);
00503 }
00504 
00505 template <class vector, class real>
00506 bool CircleTangent(vector cen,real rad,vector p,
00507                    vector &left,vector &right)
00508 {
00509   vector delta,basis;
00510   vector tl,tr;
00511   double d2,l,t;
00512 
00513   // l,r,d form a right triangle where l*l + rad*rad = d*d = d2
00514   delta = cen - p;
00515   d2 = delta.sqlength();
00516 
00517   t = d2 - rad*rad;
00518   if(t < 0) return(false); // inside circle
00519 
00520   // set basis as sin/d,cos/d
00521   l = sqrt(t);
00522   basis.set(l/d2,rad/d2);
00523 
00524   // project to get left and right tangents
00525   // resulting vectors are normalized
00526   left  = basis.project_out(delta)*l;
00527   basis.y = -basis.y;
00528   right = basis.project_out(delta)*l;
00529 
00530   return(true);
00531 }
00532 
00533 // calculate the unit vector pointing at the "midpoint" of a line
00534 // based on splitting the angle from the origin.  The unit vector is
00535 // returned, while the distance is stored in <dist>.  dir*dist lies on
00536 // the line p0-p1.
00537 template <class vector, class real>
00538 vector LineMidpointAngular(const vector &p0,const vector &p1,real &dist)
00539 {
00540   vector dir = (p0.norm() + p1.norm()).norm();
00541   vector pn = (p1 - p0).norm();
00542   dist = pn.perpdot(p0) / pn.perpdot(dir);
00543   return(dir);
00544 }
